intro: Elatostema yaoshanense, commonly known as the Yaoshan Elatostema, is a small herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes plants commonly known as nettles. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and it produces small greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and understudied species in botanical research.
